pull.title: build: test for timingsafe_bcmp
pull.body:
Code introduced in #15649 added usage of [`timingsafe_bcmp()`](https://man.openbsd.org/timingsafe_bcmp.3), if
available, otherwise falling back to our own implementation. However
the relevant build system check was never added, so currently, we'll
always just use our implementation, as `HAVE_TIMINGSAFE_BCMP` will never
be defined.

Add the check for `timingsafe_bcmp`. Note that as far as I'm aware, it's
only available on OpenBSD.

https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/c3daa321f921f4e2514ef93c48d39ae39e7f2d46/src/crypto/chacha_poly_aead.cpp#L16-L28

events.body:
Testing on OpenBSD 7.1, the configure script detects `timingsafe_bcmp` correctly:
```
$ ./configure MAKE=gmake
...
checking for timingsafe_bcmp... yes
...
```

Unfortunately, it still uses our implementation, because `HAVE_TIMINGSAFE_BCMP` is not set:
```diff
diff --git a/src/crypto/chacha_poly_aead.cpp b/src/crypto/chacha_poly_aead.cpp
index 4f3e6f7fa..4a852c055 100644
--- a/src/crypto/chacha_poly_aead.cpp
+++ b/src/crypto/chacha_poly_aead.cpp
@@ -15,6 +15,8 @@

 #ifndef HAVE_TIMINGSAFE_BCMP

+XXX throwanerrorhere XXX
+
 int timingsafe_bcmp(const unsigned char* b1, const unsigned char* b2, size_t n)
 {
     const unsigned char *p1 = b1, *p2 = b2;

```
```
$ gmake -j4
...
  CXX      crypto/libbitcoin_crypto_base_la-chacha_poly_aead.lo
crypto/chacha_poly_aead.cpp:18:1: error: unknown type name 'XXX'
XXX throwanerrorhere XXX
^
crypto/chacha_poly_aead.cpp:18:21: error: expected ';' after top level declarator
XXX throwanerrorhere XXX
                    ^
                    ;
2 errors generated.
...
```

Adding the missing include `<config/bitcoin-config.h>` fixes this:
```diff
diff --git a/src/crypto/chacha_poly_aead.cpp b/src/crypto/chacha_poly_aead.cpp
index 4f3e6f7fa..f736b2d86 100644
--- a/src/crypto/chacha_poly_aead.cpp
+++ b/src/crypto/chacha_poly_aead.cpp
@@ -2,6 +2,10 @@
 // Distributed under the MIT software license, see the accompanying
 // file COPYING or http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php.

+#if defined(HAVE_CONFIG_H)
+#include <config/bitcoin-config.h>
+#endif
+
 #include <crypto/chacha_poly_aead.h>

 #include <crypto/poly1305.h>
```

verification.payload:
tree 196a12d1159b9d54c525e5eb223f22aec4191202
parent e3c08eb620a2f317fc09fdf20969fa26f02afb91
author fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1654856089 +0100
committer fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1654861148 +0100

build: test for timingsafe_bcmp

Code introduced in #15649 added usage of `timingsafe_bcmp()`, if
available, otherwise falling back to our own implementation. However
the relevant build system check was never added, so currently, we'll
always just use our implementation, as HAVE_TIMINGSAFE_BCMP will never
be defined.

Add the check for timingsafe_bcmp. Note that as far as I'm aware, it's
only available on OpenBSD.

events.message:
build: test for timingsafe_bcmp

Code introduced in #15649 added usage of `timingsafe_bcmp()`, if
available, otherwise falling back to our own implementation. However
the relevant build system check was never added, so currently, we'll
always just use our implementation, as HAVE_TIMINGSAFE_BCMP will never
be defined.

Add the check for timingsafe_bcmp. Note that as far as I'm aware, it's
only available on OpenBSD.

events.body:
I never realized that this is an existing libc function on any platform.
